title: Compton - how does photon model predict wavelength

content.question: Electromagnetic waves, in the form of x-rays with a specific wavelength, are observed to scatter off of a material. The scattered waves exhibit a wavelength shift that depends on the angle at which the waves are scattered. Which of the following provides evidence that the electromagnetic waves can be treated as a collection of discrete, quantized energy packets (i.e., photons)?

choices.label: Modeling the waves as individual particles, and applying conservation of energy and conservation of momentum to a collision between two of the particles
Modeling the waves as individual particles, and applying conservation of energy and conservation of momentum to a collision between one of the particles and an electron
Modeling the waves as individual rays, and calculating the effective index of refraction for a ray traveling more slowly when it is inside the material
Modeling the waves as individual rays, and calculating the effective index of refraction for a ray refracting or bending when it passes close to an electron

content.answer: Modeling the waves as individual particles, and applying conservation of energy and conservation of momentum to a collision between one of the particles and an electron
